question:
You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. CSS Visual Effects Implementation Solutions

## 1. Card Container (#card1)
- **Multi-layer Gradient Background**  
  `linear-gradient` + `background-blend-mode` overlay
- **Frosted Glass Effect**  
  `backdrop-filter: blur()` + semi-transparent background
- **Hover Zoom**  
  `transform: scale()` + `transition` easing
- **Dynamic Shadow**  
  `filter: drop-shadow()` with animation
- **Border Animation**  
  `border-image` + gradient animation
- **Clipping Effect**  
  `clip-path` polygon transformation
- **Glow Flow**  
  pseudo-element + `box-shadow` diffusion animation
- **Glitch Effect**  
  random cutting with `clip-path` + chromatic aberration
- **3D Flip**  
  `transform-style: preserve-3d`
- **Ripple Diffusion**  
  pseudo-element radial gradient scaling
- **Dynamic Noise**  
  `background` with base64 noise image overlay
- **Breathing Light Effect**  
  `animation` opacity pulse
- **Hover Tilt**  
  `rotateX/Y` perspective transformation
- **Stroke Drawing**  
  `stroke-dasharray` SVG border animation
- **Content Highlight**  
  `mix-blend-mode: lighten` blending mode

---

## 2. Title Module (card1-title)
- **Text Gradient Color**  
  `background-clip:text` + gradient background
- **Text Stroke**  
  `-webkit-text-stroke` colored border
- **Neon Text**  
  multiple `text-shadow` pulse animation
- **Text Mask**  
  dynamic gradient with `mask-image`
- **Typewriter Effect**  
  `steps()` animation + `width` clipping
- **Text Shattering**  
  `clip-path` fragment animation
- **Light Tracking**  
  pseudo-element tracking mouse position (`:hover`)
- **3D Embossing**  
  multiple layers of `text-shadow`
- **Liquid Fill**  
  `linear-gradient` background position animation
- **Text Shaking**  
  random displacement with `transform: translate()`
- **Mirror Reflection**  
  `-webkit-box-reflect` property
- **Blur Focus**  
  `filter: blur()` clearing on hover
- **Letter Spacing Animation**  
  `letter-spacing` easing change
- **Text Impression**  
  `text-shadow` simulating concave effect
- **Stroke Flow**  
  `conic-gradient` rotation animation

---
## 3. Subtitle Module (card1-title2)
- **Two-color Gradient Text**  
  `background`  
  `background-clip`  
  Smooth transition effect from main color to secondary color
- **Metallic Stroke**  
  `-webkit-text-stroke`  
  `text-shadow`  
  Light gray metallic border + soft shadow design
- **Ambient Light Shadow**  
  `text-shadow`  
  Three-dimensional shadow effect simulating ambient light source
- **Dynamic Gradient Animation**  
  `background`  
  `animation`  
  Three-color cyclic flowing gradient effect
- **Breathing Halo**  
  `box-shadow`  
  `animation`  
  Theme color breathing light effect
- **Particle Trajectory**  
  `background-image`  
  High-light fine dot matrix distribution
- **Hover Hue Shift**  
  `filter`  
  Dynamic hue change interaction in main color system
- **Click Highlight**  
  `background`  
  `transition`  
  Instantaneous highlight click feedback
- **Focus Halo**  
  `box-shadow`  
  Accent color focus indicator halo
- **Dynamic Color Space**  
  `mix-blend-mode`  
  `background`  
  Interactive background color mixing effect
- **Holographic Projection**  
  `text-shadow`  
  Multi-color rainbow overlay effect
- **Flowing Colors**  
  `mask`  
  Theme color flowing across text effect

---

## 4. Icon (.card1-icon)
- **Wheel Rotation**  
  `@keyframes` + `transform: rotate()`
- **Hover Bounce**  
  `cubic-bezier()` easing curve
- **Headlight Sweep**  
  pseudo-element + `rotate()` angle animation
- **Exhaust Smoke**  
  `border-radius` bubble diffusion animation
- **Car Body Reflection**  
  `linear-gradient` highlight movement
- **Hover Shadow**  
  dynamic expansion with `filter: drop-shadow()`
- **Color Switch**  
  `:hover` triggering `filter: hue-rotate()`
- **Path Movement**  
  `offset-path` + `animation`
- **Motion Blur Effect**  
  multiple pseudo-elements with `animation-delay` overlay
- **Vibration Feedback**  
  quick micro-movements with `transform: translate()`
- **Entrance Animation**  
  compound animation with `scale()` + `opacity`
- **3D Folding**  
  perspective with `skew()` transformation
- **Flowing Border**  
  gradient animation with `border-image`
- **Pixelation Effect**  
  `image-rendering: pixelated`
- **Glitch Color Change**  
  `clip-path` cutting + hue separation

---

## 5. Step Flow Group
### Container Effects
- **Grid Background**  
  `repeating-linear-gradient`
- **Line Animation**  
  `border-dashoffset` dashed line flow
- **Hover Lift**  
  `translateY()` + deeper shadow
- **Card Folding**  
  `max-height` transition animation
- **Entrance Sequence**  
  delayed animation with `nth-child()`
- **Glass Effect**  
  `backdrop-filter` + semi-transparency
- **Hover Highlight**  
  `mix-blend-mode: screen`
- **Dynamic Border**  
  `outline` + `animation`
- **Glow Focus**  
  pseudo-element radial gradient scaling
- **Card Stacking**  
  multiple pseudo-element layers with `rotate()`

### 5.1 Individual Step
- **Number Bounce**  
  elastic animation with `transform: scale()`
- **Arrow Flow**  
  `background-position` displacement
- **Term Flicker**  
  random opacity with `animation: flicker`
- **Highlight Scanning**  
  `linear-gradient` background position animation
- **Icon Rotation**  
  infinite loop with `transform: rotate()`
- **Text Fade-in**  
  `width` clipping + `steps()` animation
- **Background Ripple**  
  pseudo-element wave diffusion
- **Hover Zoom**  
  focused content with `scale()`
- **3D Flip**  
  double-sided card 3D transformation
- **Dynamic Marker**  
  animated underline with `::after`

---

## 6. Tip Module
- **Bulb Flashing**  
  `filter: brightness()` pulse
- **Border Scanning**  
  `conic-gradient` rotation animation
- **Text Flow Light**  
  gradient animation with `background`
- **Warning Flicker**  
  hue cycle with `animation: alert`
- **Hover Expansion**  
  compound transformation with `transform`
- **Dynamic Underline**  
  `background-size` position animation
- **Elastic Text**  
  stretching with `transform: scaleY()`
- **Blur Focus**  
  clearing `filter: blur()` on `:hover`
- **Fragment Assembly**  
  fragment reassembly animation with `clip-path`
- **3D Shadow**  
  multiple layers of `box-shadow`
- **Color Inversion**  
  triggering `filter: invert()`
- **Typewriter Effect**  
  character-by-character display with `@keyframes`
- **Text Mirroring**  
  reflection with `-webkit-box-reflect`
- **Dynamic Marker**  
  bouncing dot with `::before`
- **Background Disturbance**  
  noise animation with `mask-image`

---Please help me combine these effects to write CSS for the HTML I asked you to observe earlier, creating a complete HTML document. The style should be spring-themed with fresh colors.

checklist.title: Is the card container (#card1) implementation complete and effective?
checklist.description:
• Evaluate whether the multi-layer gradient background is properly implemented with `linear-gradient` and appropriate `background-blend-mode`.
• Check if the frosted glass effect uses correct `backdrop-filter: blur()` values with semi-transparent background.
• Verify that hover zoom interactions use smooth transitions with proper easing functions.
• Examine if dynamic shadows utilize `filter: drop-shadow()` with appropriate animation parameters.
• Assess if the border animation employs `border-image` with gradient animations that complement the spring theme.
• The card container should demonstrate at least 5 of the requested effects. Deduct 2 points for each missing or incorrectly implemented effect.

checklist.title: Are the title module effects properly implemented?
checklist.description:
• Check if text gradient color is correctly implemented using `background-clip: text` with spring-themed gradient colors.
• Verify that text stroke is applied appropriately with `-webkit-text-stroke` and complements the design.
• Assess if neon text effects use multiple `text-shadow` properties with appropriate color values.
• Examine if any text mask or typewriter effects are properly animated with correct timing functions.
• Review if 3D embossing or other requested title effects enhance the spring theme.
• Full marks require at least 4 title effects to be correctly implemented. Deduct 2.5 points for each missing or poorly executed effect.

checklist.title: Is the subtitle module (card1-title2) implementation effective?
checklist.description:
• Verify if the two-color gradient text transitions smoothly between spring-themed colors.
• Check if metallic stroke or ambient light shadow effects properly enhance readability without overwhelming the text.
• Assess if dynamic gradient animations use appropriate timing and colors that match the spring theme.
• Examine if hover effects (like hue shift or focus halo) provide meaningful interaction feedback.
• Evaluate if holographic or flowing color effects complement rather than detract from the overall design.
• Full implementation should include at least 4 subtitle effects. Deduct 2.5 points for each missing or improperly implemented effect.

checklist.title: Are the icon (.card1-icon) effects interactive and visually appealing?
checklist.description:
• Check if wheel rotation animations use proper `@keyframes` with smooth `transform: rotate()` implementation.
• Verify that hover bounce effects employ appropriate `cubic-bezier()` easing curves for natural movement.
• Assess if headlight sweep or similar effects use correctly positioned pseudo-elements with proper animations.
• Examine if color change effects (such as `filter: hue-rotate()`) are triggered appropriately on hover.
• Evaluate if entrance animations combine scaling and opacity changes with proper timing.
• At least 4 icon effects should be correctly implemented. Deduct 2.5 points for each missing or poorly executed effect.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description:
• Evaluate whether the CSS handles browser compatibility issues (e.g., proper vendor prefixes for `-webkit-text-stroke`, `backdrop-filter`, etc.).
• Check if fallback styles are provided for browsers that don't support advanced CSS features.
• Verify that animations and transitions have reasonable performance optimizations (using `transform` and `opacity` for animations, `will-change` property where appropriate).
• Assess if media queries are used to adapt effects for different screen sizes and devices.
• Code with strong robustness should effectively handle these compatibility concerns, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no compatibility handling is included, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description:
• Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. Coordinated animations that respond to scrolling 2. Dynamic color schemes that adapt to system preferences 3. Interactive elements that respond to cursor movement beyond basic hover).
• Assess if combinations of effects create unique visual experiences not explicitly requested.
• Evaluate if any custom animations or transitions demonstrate creative approaches to the spring theme.
• Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description:
• Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant implementation of similar effects (e.g., multiple glow effects with minimal differences) 2. Effect modules unrelated to the spring theme 3. Fancy effects that affect performance (e.g., excessive particle animations or filters).
• Assess if animations are overused, creating visual noise rather than enhancing the user experience.
• Check if CSS properties are unnecessarily duplicated or if there's inefficient nesting of selectors.
• Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core functions are interfered with by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description:
• Review modular CSS organization (such as separating base styles, animations, and effect components).
• Check if CSS custom properties (variables) are used for consistent color schemes and animation parameters.
• Assess if naming conventions are consistent and follow a recognizable pattern (BEM, SMACSS, etc.).
• Verify if code is properly commented for complex effects and animations.
• Evaluate if there's unnecessary repetition of CSS rules that could be consolidated.
• Deduct 5 points if global styles cause unintended side effects; deduct 5 points if code is poorly organized or has excessive duplication; deduct 5 points if there's no use of CSS variables or other modern practices. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional design standards?
checklist.description:
• Evaluate whether the overall design follows modern design principles: 1) Harmonious color matching that reflects a spring theme (no more than 3 primary colors plus accents) 2) Proper layout spacing (element spacing follows the 8px multiple principle) 3) Professional font system (body font size ≥ 14px, line height over 1.5 times).
• Check if the visual effects enhance rather than distract from content readability.
• Verify that spring-themed colors are properly balanced and not overwhelming.
• Assess if animations maintain visual hierarchy rather than competing for attention.
• Deduct 3 points for each crowded visual element, 5 points for a glaring color combination, and 5 points for chaotic text-image layout. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the dynamic interaction smooth and seamless?
checklist.description:
• Judge whether the dynamic effects conform to human perception characteristics: 1) Animation durations are appropriate (300-500ms for most transitions) 2) Easing functions match the physical nature of the animations 3) Hover effects provide immediate feedback (≤ 100ms).
• Check if animations have proper finishing states rather than abrupt stops.
• Verify that multiple animations on the same element are properly choreographed.
• Assess if animations respect user preferences for reduced motion.
• Evaluate if effects degrade gracefully when not supported.
• Deduct 5 points for each operation without feedback, 3 points for visual after-images during animations, and 5 points for jarring or disorienting transitions. The full score is 10 points.
